Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: zoopermom
Reviews.Content: The pros: Close to everything Well appointed with a great bathroom, good size triple room Breakfast okay, nothing special, great cappuccino, good service Car service for 55 euro from the airport, to me a bargain for 3 people and better than the alternative public transportation Restaurants galore nearby Free internet in the room Reception desk good with directions The cons: If you are an AOL or Gmail user, communication is a problem which they admit....they sent me 3 confirmations for a car service and I never received them, just relied on a verbal. Walls are thin where conversations are easily heard; we had to go down to the front desk at 2 am to ask them to call our noisy neighbors to keep it quiet, they wanted us to do it! They don't put on air conditioning in March and it was very warm in the room. You can't leave the windows open because it is noisy out on the street. At times the front desk was curt, don't know if they were too busy or stressed. All in all, this was a good hotel. We will probably try another hotel next time because the lack of air conditioning, thin walls and noisy streets made it tough for us to sleep. If you are a sound sleeper then this place is for you. A native friend of ours recommended Cul de Sac restaurant with an extensive wine list and very knowledgeable waiters. We ordered pate which the French claim to do best, but it was the best we have ever tasted. Fantastic entrees, you will not be disappointed. We will go back there next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emilycook02
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with the Albergo Ottocento Hotel in Piazza Barberini. Quiet street, but close to everything. The Spanish Steps, great shopping and Trevi Fountain were just a 5 minute walk away and metro station (Barberini/Trevi Fountain) is just around the corner. Be sure to make reservations and visit Osteria Barberini where we had our favorite dinner in Rome just a few steps away. The staff was very kind and helpful, the room was incredibly clean (a tiny bit small, but perfect for Italy), the shower was amazing and internet free. Our room had a large lovely window, that shuttered out the noise and light at night for a great sleep, and overlooked a lovely quiet street during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Andyic72
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel, location is 5 min walk Trevi fountain and 5 min Spanish steps. You are central to everything. Staff were helpful, room nice size, great bathroom and shower, comfortable bed. A few small points, the air conditioning wasn't working and towel rail in bathroom couldnt be turned off, bathroom was sweltering due to this. If mid summer this could have been a problem!! The only other thing to watch for is the lack of soundproofing between rooms. To put in context reception rang me and said next room complained of music coming from our room, for anyone with an I phone I was playing music just through the phone speaker, 2 notches from loudest! Wasn't a problem and wouldn't put me off but just be aware of it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Comfortable, Hospitable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beach85girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for a week at the end of January with another couple. We were surprised to find the rooms to be a very nice size and a beautiful bathroom. It was very clean and welcoming. The location is excellent and we walked everywhere.The entire staff was extremely welcoming and assisted us in any of our questions. The wait staff in the dining room, where the food was wonderful (surprising for a hotel) were courteous and informative. A wonderful experience for our first trip to Europe. We highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Schwabbie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early October. We arrived at the hotel around midday and were shown to our room. We were in a double room at the back of the hotel with a private outdoor area. The room was an average size, the bed comfortable and the bathroom modern and clean. The room was quiet when we closed the large doors to the court yard area. After our first night we awoke to a room that was very warm. After we had breakfast, we went to reception to complain that our air con was not working. We were informed that it had been turned off for the whole of the hotel. We expressed our dissatisfaction at this and requested it be turned on as our room was becoming a sauna, especially after showering. We were told management had to approve this. We instructed the receptionist to call to get authorisation. Eventually, management begrudingly turned it on. We had to go through this process every day. This was the only downside of our stay. Breakfast was very nice. The location was perfect. The hop on/hop off bus is located around the corner. It is close to a metro station. Mind you, next time I would take a cab from the main rail station to the hotel as opposed to walking the 1km, as we were constantly going up and down stair (no escalators) which was really hard going with large suitcases. We felt this hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great location and very friendly staff - excellent shower!”
Reviews.Author: bluemelly
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a wonderful 3 days in Roma. This hotel is in a great location, the room was lovely (windows you can open, always a winner) and a suprisingly spacious bathroom with an excellent shower - something that is quite difficult to find in Europe Its about a 12 minute walk from Termini and 5 mins to spanish steps and trevi fountain. Loads of lovely restaurants around, would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ceccina
Reviews.Content: Better late than never. We were in Rome during August 2011 and stayed at Ottocento for 4 days. No complaints whatsoever. Nice small hotel near Piazza Barberini and only a short walk to the top of Piazza D'Spagna. Easy to get around by foot of subway. Nicola is a great host and very helpful. We booked ahead online for the Vatican Museum and were able to by-pass the long line when we got there. Booking online isn't easy but worth it. You can pay more and you can go for bigger but won't get better. This is a great local boutique hotel. Not our last visit. Try the granita at Blue Ice just up Via Sistina. Really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good quality”
Reviews.Author: VDimus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in Rome to stay for three days in August 2011 after a suggestion by a good friend. We are glad we did as it turned out quite good. The location is very good, just a few minutes on foot from Piazza di Spagnia and Fontana di Trevi. Lots of convenient metro and bus connections too to go further. The personnel was very helpful and the rooms clean and tidy. The hotel looks recently renovated, although the elevator is quite small. Breakfast was good and the buffet quite complete. We tried the restaurant on the ground floor once but were not too excited. Overall a good value hotel in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale but not too pricey”
Reviews.Author: SDGirl92128
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers spacious rooms which are hard to find in Euro metro cities. Everything was clean, staff was friendly and best of all...the hotel is situated near the Spanish Steps. From there you can walk or use metro to get to the other sights. The staff will also arrange a taxi for a set price to fiumicino so you don't get overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: folias
Reviews.Content: i choose this hotel because from the comments about position,staff.i am very happy for that,great position to see Rome. i hope i will visit Rome again,and sure that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's one stop shop!”
Reviews.Author: Jody H
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome for the first time and were more than overjoyed at the hotel and its location when we reached it from the airport. It is central with tube and bus connections adjacent to it. In terms of noise, this was non existant as the hotel lay one street back from the hustle and bustle. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and made our stay a very nice one. They helped with tips and advise on where to eat what to see and to book specific trips like the visit to the Villa Borghese. The room were clean, new and modern albeit not large we were informed that most hotels in Rome are of these specs. It is most definitely recommended especially after seeing some of the other hotles and their locations vis a vis the OttoCento. The food in their restaturant was very good and represented local traditional dishes prepared by a true Italian chef. All Major attactions were nearby e.g. Spanish steps, Piazza de Popolo, the Bourghese Park and Villa, the Trevi fountain, The panteon...... so it was a good start! :-) . We highly recommend the hotel! We travelled in mid October and the weather (to our luck) was still hot and dry avg. around 20 degrees C during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: loubnasuccar
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely friendly and available, 5 minutes walk to trevi and spanish steps. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and the Albergo Ottocento made it a simple pleasure to explore Rome. The airport pick-up service arranged through the hotel was prompt and efficient. The concierge and hotel staff were all multilingual and helpful. The rooftop restaurant was a delight in the late evening. Conveniently located, many attractions are within easy walking distance including the Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi. Thanks to the front desk staff we were able to reserve last minute tickets to the nearby Borghese Gallery. With two metro stops a short walk from the front door, even the more distant attractions are quickly accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Convenient, and Comforting”
Reviews.Author: Racheal C
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute amendment from 2pax to 3pax/room but the hotel handled it really well. The check-in was a breeze! It was really convenient to walk around to most of the major spots. I had a great time there. :)

Reviews.Title: “A judicious Choice”
Reviews.Author: jmlangl
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Rome, we chose to stay at the hotel «Albergo Ottocento». We were delighted with our choice. Our room eventhough a little small was very comfortable, well decorated and absolutely spotless. The location of the hotel is perfect. The proximity to the metro station and bus stop (a few minutes walk) facilitates the visit of all main sites in Rome. We expected to be disturbed by the noise usually present in such a busy city. On the contrary, we were agreeably surprised by the tranquility of the environment. The staff is friendly, helpful, very efficient and speaks excellent English. We highly recommend the hotel «Albergo Ottocento» to anyone visiting Rome. We will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, not sure about the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: KKTravel_10
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a decent hotel for the price in a good location at Piazza Barberini with good proximity to some sites (Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Villa Borghese, Train Station, Metro etc.). The reception service is good, the rooms spacious, the cleaning service very reliable with spacious bathroom and nice interior. Wireless is free and works although slow and tedious with passwords on each log on etc. Most channels on my TV had weak or no signal, but you could watch italian news and some soaps and MTV. Two things where not ideal: the breakfast buffet is basic, OK for italian standards (not a breakfast kind of country anyway), but the table cloths where often not clean, and the room overheated (or not air conditioned). The other issue that has already been mentioned by others is the "upgrade" to the "suite". This is not a real upgrade in my view, since the overall space is the same or less than for a normal room, just that the room is divided into two levels, so you have to walk up to your bed, and down to a small area with sofa and TV, mini bar, bathroom etc. The problem here is that, when it's hot and the air conditioner is running, the warm air is in the sleeping area (up) and the cold air down (sofa, TV). After I was offered this "upgrade" I decided against it, and got offered a decent room with equal space, and a little terrace, same as the "suite". So overall, nice hotel, reasonable price for location and quality, NO VIEWS in case you expected any, but some rooms have a view to the street, the others into a somewhat uneventful courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristinaNJ
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome several times and have tried various hotels. This was exactly what I was looking for in a hotel in Rome. I wanted to find a quaint, picturesque, well-located hotel that would have a real european feel to it while being clean, comfortable and updated. After much research I selected this hotel. The location is perfect for Rome! The room was small, yes, but that is to be expected in all european cities. The bathroom was modern and very nice. Breakfast was good, surprised to find hot eggs as part of the buffet. The ONLY downside- some of the front desk people were unfriendly and even gave us some attitude during our stay. There was only one person who was actually friendly and smiled and didn't mind answering our questions. The gem of this hotel is the rooftop! Very romantic setting for pictures, drinks and dinner! If they had music up there it would be perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeChino
Reviews.Content: This facility is very centraly located. The breakfast was great the room was quiet and very clean. The staff was very helpful with everything we needed. The outdoors restaurant on the top floor was an excellent way to end our day. We ate there 4 times and it was the best food and service we had. Great facility and staff.

Reviews.Title: “very well located”
Reviews.Author: mks012
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. There is easy access to public transport., if you are tired from walking. The staff was very helpfull. Our room (103) was small and had a smell, (perhaps from the kitchen?), but it looked to a sympatish patio and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but probally not again.”
Reviews.Author: phoenix100
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our short stay in Rome. I chose the hotel after reading the reviews and hoped it would be great. I am a seasoned traveler and like very nice accommodations, so I was a bit disappointed. There were 3 in the room and it was soooo small that we had to rearrange the furniture so we could open our suitcases. There was a small closet, but No drawers anywhere! Everything had to stay in the suitcases. The room was clean, with a small TV and minibar (which we couldn't open because of the 3rd bed, and a note which said " nothing was allowed in the fridge except what they put in it!) Absolutely no frills. It was very plain and non descript room.Like most Italian hotels, but bath was remodeled. For the price we paid, I expected more. Breakfast was ok, again nothing special. The elevator worked, but it was hard for 3 of us to fit in it (and I am only 5' tall!) Hallways were not that clean and hot. The nicest person was the gentleman at the night desk who gave us dining suggestions. Yes the internet was free, however you had to always go downstairs and get the password because you were alotted a certain amount of time per password. All in all the location was perfect, but I don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: crop1959
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location central to every thing it had small rooms but very clean the breakfast was good selection . The mattress was ok a bit hard The staff were very helpful and nicolh on the front desk Was very friendly and helpful he was a pleasure to deal with at all times

Reviews.Title: “great rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: DEBBIE51
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed there May 13-16, 2011 - good location, close to Barberini Piazza where we could catch the hop on hop off tour bus. This was a great way to see Rome and the Vatican. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. Our room was quite a good size, with a small balcony. Not all the same priced rooms were as large. The breakfast was really good - several meats, cheese, scrambled eggs, pastries, fruit and yogurt. The cappucino was amazing...you just had to ask for it. We ate at the rooftop restaurant one night - two levels - lots of plants and a very nice setting. The food was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel close to the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Marj H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Rome just after 6.00 a.m. following a long haul flight from Australia. Although it was too early to check in to the hotel we were provided with a free airport pick up in a BMW. I had requested the hotel by email prior to our arrival to book a nearby restaurant for lunch which had come highly recommended on Tripadvisor. After an enjoyable culinary introduction to Rome we returned to the hotel, indulged in the deep tub and curled up in our large bed where we stayed until morning. The room was tastefully furnished and we were very happy with our choice. The only negative for me was the very firm mattress and uncomfortable pillows, I even considered purchasing a pillow. After spending a month travelling through Italy we soon discovered that most hotel beds were firm to hard and pillows were either too firm or too soft. The staff at this hotel were friendly and quick to assist and the location is perfect. We walked everywhere during our four day stay and have returned home with wonderful memories of Rome. We would definitely return to Albergo Ottocento if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not a diamant”
Reviews.Author: Tallustaja
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located to a smaller and quieter street, but when the city of Roma wakes up you can sense it, after all the busy Barberini junction isn't that far away. To our misfortune a car alarm went off nearby and kept as awake for one night. Great thing is the near by metro station which makes it easy to explore the city. I think the Italians like hard beds since our room had ones (this manifested itself also in another hotel). Those and the combination of walking all day long was poison to my back. Staff was helpful and looked after our luggage before we could use our room. They also gave tips about the restaurants. One minus was that the staff walked in our room without knocking the door. What if we wouldn't been decently clothed? Breakfast was delicious and enjoyable. At our stay we didn't see a climpse of the mentioned roof garden, but we didn't ask about it either. We ate our breakfast in Rossini downstairs. Without a doubt this hotel can use the term buotique hotel to describe the elegant interior. And room was clean and tidy. All in all it was a good stay and good hotel but next time I will try out something else.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel, well located, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Edu_y_Adri
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel, very warm, well located, excellent service. We spent a few wonderful days with my husband Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: StevieRob46
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel could not be located more conveniently to many of the 'must see' sights of Rome. A short 5/6 minute stroll to the Trevi Fountain and about the same to the famous Spanish Steps and Pantheon. There is an abundance of local cafes and restaurants just around the corner serving deliceous food and drinks,reasonably priced.The hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful. The hotel is typically Roman in style lots of marble and spotlessly clean, and our room was cleaned and towels changed every day. Breakfast was a little disapointing with no cooked meats available,but you are spoiled for choice to eat 2 minutes away.I would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.(and already have done)

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice-”
Reviews.Author: SignCliente
Reviews.Content: I believe that the real good points of this hotel are the position: in the real heart of Rome, the cleanliness and a reasonable breakfast. My experience has been very negative for the below reasons: I was confirmed a “deluxe” double room, king bed. When we arrived the receptionist said we were upgraded to a “suite”. This suite was a real problem for me (I have big problems with legs and cannot easily use steps) as there was not lift to the room and the room itself was a room on two levels connected by steps, again very uncomfortable for me. I believe that they would have thought that, BEFORE any change ,they should ask themselves if the room can be used by anyone or it is the case to ask if customer can really use a two level room. Only young couple with no mobility problem could, I am sure. We were given then a “standard” or I would define better sub-standard room, again with some steps to do after the lift (fewer than for the suite) with no normal windows except a very small one on the top of a wall, which could be opened and closed with a device, while in the bathroom the small windows was not accessible at all ,nor any extractor fan was available, with all imaginable consequences. Neither in the room or in the bathroom was available a hang for clothes, only a small wardrobe in the room. The bathroom was big but with a very very small single washbasin, again with no hangs for towels. The biggest problem was that you cannot set individually the room temperature, it was extremely hot inside and the air conditioner was not working. When we claimed to have a big problem, a man came in our room, closed the heater in the bathroom and said no fresh air was available from the air conditioner and the unique way to freshen up the air was to open the small windows on top of the wall which was in face of the beds (yes also two separate beds…..).Of course we did for a while, but since we could not look out of that high small windows so we feared some animal could enter ,and also because outside was very cold, we had to sleep with the windows completely closed at very hot temperature. Terrific experience! A nightmare. We immediately pointed out the temperature issue, but we were told the hotel was fully booked. At check out no word of excuses whatsoever. Or any form of reimbursement. I understand that this hotel has been built starting on an old building, but the design was very poor either regarding the way the rooms are connected each other (too many steps), either regarding air-conditioning systems. Were we just unlucky?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: tg0810
Reviews.Content: 3 adults stayed 5 nights in hotel. Clean rooms with free wifi and good breakfast included in rate. Hotel is located block from Rome Metro which we used everyday. Easy walking distance to Pantheon, Piazza Navona. Friendly staff helped with museum reservations, advice on shopping and arranging sidetrips. Would definintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: simone949
Reviews.Content: This is a small elegant hotel in Rome where we found the location and amenities to be excellent. Rooms are typical European small, but well appointed. The staff was very helpful and the breakfasts more than adequate. The hotel rooftop for dinner is quaint and the food delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very close to the A line.”
Reviews.Author: ckr27
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located with easy access to other parts of the city. Rooms were clean and a nice size. Staff was wonderful and helped get reservations for the Borghese Gallery on short notice. Drinks on the roof top were great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel and Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: patriciaw9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June and loved the location of this hotel and it is in a very quiet street so close to the Spanish Steps. The staff very efficient and helpful and polite. The rooftop restaurant is great. The rooms a bit small but still very comfortable and our room had a spa too. I definately would book this hotel again at our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: izzetmegi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my girlfriend 6 days in august, first of all i have to say that the staff in the hotel is just perfect, they helped us so much and gave us also many tips where to go and what to do that you cant find in guide books. We have stayed at double deluxe room , it was very clean, the bed was comfortable and bathroom was also very clean with perfect bathtube. Breakfast was also good, i recommend everybody also to have dinner in the hotel very delicious italian food. The hotel is very close to trevi fountain , spanish steps and pantheon. also 2 minutes walk to the metro. very good location. the hotel is in the small street so no noise, could sleep in quiet. i recommend everybody to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrianBooth67
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in Rome and wanted a hotel in the centre. Our friends recommended the hotel and it lived up to expectations. It is close to the Spanish steps so it is ideal to see the centre. The staff were friendly and helpful during our stay. The restaurant was very good with a great selection of food. We had two rooms, one for my wife and I and another for our 3 teenage sons. The hotel is value for money, great location and very friendly. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints except the a/c”
Reviews.Author: SummerOldsmar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent but my only complaint was the a/c. When the staff was told, their response was that it was very hot outside. The hotel was close to 2 metros and within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Breakfast was the best from our Italy trip. Would i stay here again? Only if the a/c situation was fixed.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thetoe13
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. My family of 5 reserved two rooms for five days; a triple and a double deluxe. Rooms were on the small side but the bathrooms were nice. We traveled the first week of July and the heat and humidity were brutal. We found ourselves taking a couple of cold showers a day just to cool off. Hotel has AC but it’s the European version not the sub-zero we out west expect (100 F outside 75 F inside). I enjoyed the breakfasts in the morning and did cut down on expenses as a result. Front desk help was excellent. Both Nikolai and Simone were extremely friendly and helpful. The only complaint that I had was the HD flat screen only had three channels, CNN international, a German station, and Spanish channel. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - worth money”
Reviews.Author: RomanSad
Reviews.Content: I spend there only one night. But hotel impressed me, place is very romantic, rooms are nice, staff is kind, friendly and extremaly helpfull. This is kind of boutiq hotel. Location is very good - just in the middle of old city. It is difficult to drive there by car or taxi, but it is easy to get by metro).

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marleymom1
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, friendly staff and even includes a continental breakfast. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for exploring Rome.”
Reviews.Author: barb499
Reviews.Content: Small, but with all desired services and a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is run as a hobby not a business”
Reviews.Author: Hoteltrade
Reviews.Content: Not recommend as a business traveller. Hotel is run like hobby, rather than a business. They don’t even trust their regular guests. I was extremely disappointed by the level and quality of service. I came to Rome on a work assignment for the Goverment Finance Ministry. Hotel has no irons or no laundry. I would NOT recommend this Hotel to anyone coming to Rome on business,

Reviews.Title: “No Bellman at This Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: GoCaps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Ottocento in Rome in a suite for two nights in May. Overall, the hotel was very nice. The breakfast was good and the restaurant staff was very friendly. We liked the location which offered easy walking distance to the top of the Spanish Steps and the the Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto etc. The day desk clerk was lovely and very professiona but we were not impressed with the evening and late shift staffl. Unfortunately, we were not pre-advised that the suite we reserved required us to walk up two flights of stairs as the elevator in this hotel does not serve the suite floor. We were OK with this since there was a bellman on duty during the day when we checked in. However, we found out the hard way that this hotel does not employ a bellman during the late shift. On the morning we checked out we had a taxi pick us up at 6 am to take us to the airport. When I called for a bellman, I was told that there was no bellman employed during the late shifts. I had to carry 7 pieces of luggage (we were on a lengthly trip abroad), including two that weighed almost 50 lbs. each down two flights of stairs to our waiting taxi. I would not have stayed at this hotel if I had known that it did not provide a bellman.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stuff, very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Korinthios
Reviews.Content: The best of this hotel is its possition and the stuff of the restaurant and reception. Especially Samir, Roberto and Ioanna are great and very helpfull employees! In addition, all the receptionists were very kind and excessively helpfull. The only serious problem of this hotel is that rooms are really very small! This makes your stay in Ottocento hotel boring and heavy. Furthermore, breakfast is just adequate. Conclusively, this is one of the best solution in Rome, where 4 star hotels has nothing common with 4 stars hotels of other european capitals. Finally, i have to mention that Albergo Ottocento was the best hotel between all the others, that i found in the internet and then i saw them in person during my visit in rome

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,location,staff,and very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maddy79usa
Reviews.Content: he had a wonderful stay at Albergo Ottocento, very nice and clean rooms, friendly staff at the reception desk,restaurant and breakfast room.the location is super, 5 minutes walking distance from the spanish steps,trevi fountain.we would recomend this hotel to all our friends.he will be back again to Ottocento

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: march37
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an excellent choice. Quiet, very clean, in great location -you could walk to almost all touristique attractions- about 200m from the Barberini metro stop, 20m from Via Veneto, so close to Spanish steps, Fontana di Trevi, Villa Borghese. The breakfast was very good and the staff very helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “optimal stay”
Reviews.Author: denBucharest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very nice surprise, by that i mean first of all its location- a few minutes from Fontana di Trevi, walking distance from other major touristique sites in center of Rome; after that, the personel was top rate, and not to be forgotten the room- quiet, nice, clean ( including the bathroom), pretty good feeling to return to after an entire day spent walking, visiting. Good breakfast included, nice weather- an winning recipe to get you in the mood for visiting Rome and for returning again to a nice place...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at great location with excellent offers”
Reviews.Author: YiannisPeri
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what we expected to find based on the reviews!! The service was excellent, staff was very professional, food was great. The location is excellent, just minutes from Piazza di Spania and Capuccin Crypt. Great location for people who like shopping at Via Condotti and Via Del' Corso. I know now where to stay when I go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, great location, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: hgoldman77
Reviews.Content: This little hotel on a narrow Rome sidestreet is just a minute's walk from Via Veneto and Piazza Barberini, so it's near the Metro, the Spanish Steps, the Villa Borghesi. It's clean, well-run, offers an adequate breakfast. Our room didn't really have a window; elaborate drapes covered the wall, but the "window" was just a small portal at the ceiling, too high to reach.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique bargain”
Reviews.Author: reginalampert
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights 8/18-21 at Albergo Ottocento after a cruise that ended in Civitavecchia. The only weak points of the hotel are as follows: air conditioning in rooms could be better, howver, in their defense we were there when it was 109 degrees F, so I guess that any air conditioning may have not really cooled things off adequately; Wi-Fi was only in the lobby--not in rooms, however, to their credit, the lobby was furnished with a comfortable sofa and chairs (and near a cool a/c vent) so that it wasn't much of a problem; breakfast was just so-so--we've travelled extensively through Europe and have had more varied and sumptuous food, here the pastries were just adequate, there was only stewed/canned fruit, one type of cheese, one type of coldcut (we don't eat meat so we don't know how good or bad it was) some cereal , canned juices and mineral water. I will say that the cappucino was wonderful (as were the excellent coffee candies in a bowl near the front desk), and the service was very pleasant. On the good side--the hotel is right where you want to be midway between Piazza Barberini and the Spanish Steps (at the top), a block away from the Via Veneto. The rooms were very quiet, and although small, were not the uber-small, climb over suitcase small that you sometimes find in Rome (and I've stayed in a few like that). In fact, the triple room that my teenage kids had was a very decent size. The management and employees were most helpful, gracious, efficient, charming and funny, and on balance we had a most excellent and enjoyable stay. I recommend this hotel most highly because price-wise we were able to save a lot over other comparable 4 star properties in the Spanish Steps area or other areas I looked into (Pantheon, Piazza del Popolo, near the Coso, etc.). It cost us 855 Euro for 3 nights in a double and triple room--the nearest competition was over 1,000 Euro for the same type of rooms during the same time period. It gave us some money to be able to afford San Crispino Gelato near the Trvi fountain on Via de Panneteria 42. Also, if you want a restaurant tip--try Margutta Ristorarte (no this is not a typo) at Via Margutta 118. It is a restaurant/art gallery with an haute vegetarian menu--including various tasting menus. Fabulous food, with mainstream taste (if you didn't know it was a vegetarian restaurant you'd love it too). It has been around since 1979 so they must be doing something right!

Reviews.Title: “charming!”
Reviews.Author: mmcgurk
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Rome and it was a perfect hotel. It was in a great location (within walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain). Staff was friendly and breakfast buffet was decent. I highly recommend staying here! Thank you, Albergo Ottocento!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located little jewel”
Reviews.Author: MikieBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Listen, if you are looking for an affordable, small boutique hotel located near the major sights in Rome, with a comfortable air-conditioned bedroom and a spacious bathroom, this is your place. It will certainly be mine whenever I am in Rome again. Yes, the breakfast is pretty dreadful, but we don't go to Rome to eat breakfast, and there is an outdoor cafe just 3 minutes away on foot at the base of the Via Veneto that serves an American-style breakfast, if that is your thing. There is a lovely and reasonably-priced rooftop restaurant for dinner and/or just cocktails. The staff is lovely, if you just take a minute to talk to them. The hotel is NOT expensive, whatever the people from the UK may say, and it seems to me that if you lose your wedding ring and a maid finds it in the vacuum cleaner and returns it to you, you shouldn't accuse them of stealing it. That's just not cricket, old chum.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, though wonderfully located with either excellent or terrible service”
Reviews.Author: SteveM33
Reviews.Content: Ottocento is in a perfect location -- minutes from the Piazza Barberini, Vio Veneto, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Del Corso. The reception staff is either wonderfully friendly or appallingly dismal and disinterested. At over 230 euros a night, there is no excuse for a lack of exceptional service. The breakfast is awful -- we switched to this hotel after a bad experience at another hotel, and the breakfast at the other hotel was better. There was literally nothing offered but cereal, breads, and stewed fruits, and a plate of ham and cheese that smelled rank. The breakfast was so far from what the hotel looks like it was almost unbelievable. I thought we had wandered into a youth hostel. The wait service was poor -- no smiles, greeting, or enthusiasm; no checking on us if we wanted more tea/coffee, and no way to get more of this unless they returned (which they didn't). Oddly, room service was excellent and the dinner was very good value; but breakfast was substandard. Cleanliness was good, though the room wasn't serviced until well after noon. When we requested a taxi in the morning to go to the airport (Ciampino) they said 65 Euros -- we went to our room and looked online and found it for 35. My husband went to the front desk to ask about the discrepancy and book the cheaper taxi, and the surly front desk man informed him that he couldn't cancel the private car, period. I have to say, Rome in general has deteriorated, is now filthy, overcrowded, extremely overpriced, and offers little to travelers who are used to 5 star quality. Having recently stayed in NYC, London, and Paris, I am sad to say all aspects (food, shopping, hotels, transportation) of this trip were more than double in price of those other cities, and for equal to or less quality.

Reviews.Title: “A real dolce vita stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: stavySalonika
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, superb restaurant service and of course wonderful spacious and spotless rooms.But the highlight of our stay was definately the LOCATION.If you are travelling with teenage kids like we were,this hotel will absolutely give your family a real 'dolce vita' stay in ROME.Thank you ottocento for making us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but watch your things.”
Reviews.Author: Italy_Lover_2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Italy for our honeymoon in October of 2008, and Rome was our first stop. Albergo Ottocento was a beautiful hotel with friendly staff, and our room was always clean and fresh. One problem, though. His wedding ring was stolen. After searching high and low, we contacted the front desk and hours later, a cleaning staff "magically" found it in her vacuum and returned it to us. Rings are far too heavy to get sucked up. Make sure to lock everything up in the safe, and hide things in socks as well.

Reviews.Title: “Small, delightful comfort in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: bondigal
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying at the Ottocento and would recommend this hotel to anyone. My room was typically small, as are most European rooms, however the bathroom was large (almost disproportionately to the room, but hey, I wasn't complaining) Everything was very clean and well maintained and the staff were friendly and helpful, and gave me heaps of information on arrival regarding sights, transport and restaurants in the area. I could walk to all the main sites of Rome, the Vatican being the the furthest at about 30 mins.The restaurant that served breakfast downstairs made great coffee and I found the continental breakfast buffet to be good. Of course, you ARE in Rome, so don't limit yourself to one place to eat.. My sister came to stay with me for two nights and the hotel did not charge me extra for this. I could have saved money staying elsewhere in Rome, but I'm glad I didn't and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “you pay for location”
Reviews.Author: spoons74
Reviews.Content: Albergo Ottocento was mediocre at best. staying close to the top of the spanish steps was a fantastic location, thats where it ends. the rooms are tight, and despite a few dress ups here and there, its average. dont take anything electrical, plugging in involved dragging out the desk and choosing the fridge or my hair straightener. Bathrooms were good, providing you arent on the largese side. breakfast was just funny. typical european continental with package juice, package eggs and some stale bread. youre better off sacrificing the money and going to a cafe near by. there is a lovely roof top terrace if you were there in spring. oh, and the lemon sweeties in the bowl on the counter are to die for. overall, soend a few more of your hard earned euro and stay somewhere with a sense of place. BTW,if in a taxi from termini, watch out, theyll rip you off. yours in travel, spoons

Reviews.Title: “My husband's laptop was Stolen At Albergo Ottocento”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKDB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, the amenities were good, the staff was ok, the restaurant and breakfast good. Our room was tiny but nice and stylish, the bathroom with jacuzzi was great. We arrived on Fri the 21st of November. On Monday the 24th my husband needed to send an email and when he looked for his laptop it wasn't in its case. We looked averywhere, and being sure the computer had been there, asked the receptionist if she thought it was possible that someone could have taken it. She told me on the phone, with not even surprise tone in her voice: "It's unlikely but not impossible. I cannot assure you this could not have happened." I asked her very politely to find out with the cleaning personnel and the gentleman who take the suitcases to the rooms and who have the key of all of them. I have never received an answer. We decided no to ruin the rest of our first time in Rome, and given that the laptop was insured we thought that the best way to comply was sending this review and warning all future guests of Albergo Ottocento that they can be robbed there and not find a simple apollogy and least of all an investigation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: liveyourlifebefree
Reviews.Content: Had this recommended by a friend. Stayed for only 3 nights for a short weekend break. Good location, quiet and only a 5 minute walk to top of Spanish Steps. 40 minute walk to colosium. Hotel was clean, bedding and towels changed every day. Breakfast very simple but adequate to fuel up for the day. Only had one issue - shower pipe leaked, and tray filled up, i.e. didn't drain quickly enough. Reception staff were very good. Hotel arranged taxi transfers, cost 55 euros each way, so not cheap but didn't want the hassal of arranging independantly. I pre-arranged a bottle of champagne with reception which was delivered promtly to our room 5 minutes after arrival. All in all a good hotel, good location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is small as are the rooms but perfectly adequate. It is a very clean, smart hotel and the staff are exceptional. They are professional, efficient and very very pleasant. The only criticism that we had was that they have a roof terrace where they served evening meals, but unless you were eating you could not use it. This was a shame as during the day it was not used at all but guests were not allowed to sit up there to relax for half an hour or so after a long tiring day. This was our only criticism that this facility could not be used. It was a shame. Otherwise a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Seattle12
Reviews.Content: My wife and 8-year old daughter stayed for 3 nights here in late June, 2008. The hotel is in a great location. It's easy to walk or metro from the train station. It is also close to all the major sites, except maybe the Vatican. We walked to everything, even Borghese. It is small enough. The front staff was nice and professional. The rooms were typically small, but well decorated and furnished. The bathrooms were nice. Air conditioning worked okay. More often, I see european hotels with separate keys for the electricity. You have to plug the key into a slot to turn on the room's power. They have that feature here. The breakfast was average. There is a rooftop restaurant that looked nice. We didn't eat there, but did have a nice gellato. There are lots of good restaurants and shops nearby. Unfortunately, there is one restaurant just off the Piazza Barberini that has a "tout" trying to lure every obvious tourist into the restaurant. Avoid this and all places like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, fair price”
Reviews.Author: SFLO75009
Reviews.Content: Ottocento is a boutique hotel in the centre of Rome, right beside the Barberini metro and about 10 minutes from the Piazza Spagna (Spanish Steps). A great location and one that is hard to beat at this price. It has been recently renovated and the rooms, though small, are quite nice. The bathroom was of high quality, with a great shower and jacuzzi bath. We had room 104, which had a small patio on the interior courtyard. No sun and overlooked, but a nice touch and place to sit with a coffee. The staff were quite friendly and helpful, managing to iron some shirts late on Saturday night despite the laundry service being closed. They also let us take breakfast up to our room (to enjoy the patio) and to use their computer to print off the Internet. The restaurant upstairs on the terrace was expensive for what it was (80 euros for two - 1 bottle of wine, two small pasta dishes, two desserts) but had good views across town. At 230 euros a night, the place was hardly cheap, but then, Rome really isn't where one goes for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Ottocento”
Reviews.Author: Lou046
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Albergo Ottocento and it exceeded our expectations again. This hotel is conveniently located close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Hotel is clean and comfortable. The most valuable asset of this hotel is clearly its staff. The Front Desk staff is the best we have ever encountered. Friendly, efficient, helpful any adjective you can use applies to this group. They continually make our stay in Rome a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & clean”
Reviews.Author: AJ180
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary so we got given one of the bigger rooms which was nice. It is in a good location, not too busy but near Spanish Steps & Trevi, and the rooms are clean and the price was reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoGeorge
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in the center of the city, very convenient to all public transportation and near the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We stayed there for five days in Feb.-March 08 and had no problems. The desk staff was very helpful and spoke good English. The breakfast (included) was good and included scrambled eggs each day. For the price we paid, I think it was an above average deal. If you're going to do a lot of sightseeing and you are going to use public transportation, this is a very convenient place to stay. The room wasn't much to speak of, rather small, the beds were just OK, but it was very clean. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. Oh, they do have free internet availability in the lobby, so that was a big plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: AandDPortishead
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and comforatable. The restaurant food was very good but the atmosphere couldve been better (ie music playing and more cosey). Overall it was a very nice stay. Very clean and comfortable. However we were kept awake all night the first night as we could hear running water (in room 204). I eventually went to see the reception at 5.30am to ask if there was anything they could do and was told they would look at it at 8.30am. When that didnt happen I insisted they can with me to look. A very nice chap listened to the noise and we left to explore the city. When we returned the noise had been corrected (not sure what it was). After that first night we thoroughly enjoyed the stay. breakfasts were ok. Room a little smaller than I thought it would be (as we booked a deluxe room) but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: amarion
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous, quaint hotel in a big city. The location is really nice, with shopping and many cafes nearby. We walked to all of Rome's best sights from here, without taking the train, which is not recommended. The rooms were small to US standards, but decent to European standards. The room had good storage for our large suitcases and clothing in the armoire area. The vanity was a nice touch in the dressing area. The bathrooms were clean and the soaking tub was great after a long day of sightseeing in the cold air. The breakfast was good and very standard. We enjoyed it and have recommended it to many friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: hillbl47
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful stay between Christmas and New Year's. Room was a little small but adequate. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very convenient to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in central Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Queenston
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel! I stayed here for four nights in mid-October, and had a deluxe room on the third floor overlooking an inner courtyard. The room was sufficiently large for one person, but might have been a bit cramped for two. It was impeccably clean! The major strength of this hotel is the excellent staff--they really work like a team, and are invariably pleasant and efficient. The restaurant had excellent salads and pasta dishes at a reasonable price compared to the surrounding restaurants. I tried every gnocchi dish on the menu and they were all superb. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: gre824
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 5 nights at the Albergo Ottocento in October. As mentioned in many reviews the rooms are not large, but they certainly are adequate for your needs. The rooms are very clean with linens being changed on a daily basis. The staff at the front desk is extremely friendly and helpful. One morning, I had to leave prior to the breakfast room opening and they gladly accomodated me. The location is terrfic and within walking distance to most sights. The only concern we had was with the air conditioning. We were able to sleep comfortably with the windows open at night. When we had maintenance check the air conditioning it was considered to be in working order, so summer months may make a terrific experience, unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Tash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late August 07 for 3 nights with my wife during our round world holiday. After an easy and quick check in we went to our room which was on the small side, but that is what you get in europe. Room was very clean and comfortable as was the bathroom and toilet but best of all the room had air conditioning! This was great because we had three days over 40c. Breakfast was included in our rate, it was a simple continental breakfast but we were more than happy with it. The location was fabulous, only minutes walk to piazza spagna (spanish steps) and the trevi fountain and an even shorter walk to the pick up points for many tourist buses. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly especially the front reception staff. Any request was promptly taken care of with no fuss. All in all I really can't fault much, if I had to I'd say that the room was on the small side, but who cares when all we did was sleep and shower there, too much to see in rome to spend time in room! Would recommend this hotel to anybody, in a word, "Fantastico"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small Hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mom2esf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at both the Bernini Bristol and Ottocento during this visit. They are located just a block apart. This hotel was far better in every way than the "5 STAR" Bernini. My rooms (2 of them) at the Bernini had BLACK MOLD growing on the bath door frame and under the carpet.(see photos in my Bernini review)The rooms at the Ottocento are quite small by American standards and if you don't open the exterior shutters, quite dark. I liked being able to leave the shutters open in the morning and then close them to shut out the light for my afternoon siesta. The room was spotless with wood floors instead of carpet. The bathrooms are large, modern and have a wonderful jacuzzi tub. The air conditioning was better than most European hotels (the temperature when I was there was 42C). The staff at the front desk was the best I have ever experienced in any hotel. Nicola, who works the front desk at night and is a diehard Barbra Streisand fan went out of his way many times to make certain my stay was the best it could be, unlike the condescending staff at the Bernini. The location is ideal. We walked all over Rome using public transportation and the very close Termini Station. The food at the attached restaurant was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel. Sorry some of the photos are sideways. I don't know how to rotate them for the review.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: mousey12
Reviews.Content: I am very sorry to say I was disapointed with this hotel. We were in Rome last year and stayed in Hotel Elide which was ok and gets very bad reviews on Tripadvisor so I put a lot of thought into our hotel this year as we were in Rome for three days for a wedding. I really could not see any difference between this hotel and the one we stayed in last year. The room was quite small, poky and very dark and whilst it was very clean I thought it quite drab and depressing. The people on reception were very professional and very helpful but then they also were in Hotel Elide! I suppose the major pluses are it's location - just a stones throw from the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto, the helpfulness of the staff and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Ottocento!”
Reviews.Author: jwb_ireland
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Ottocento and, once again, it met all of our expectations. A great location, very friendly and professional staff, nice furnishings/decoration, fantastic shower (a rarity in Italian hotels I'm discovering!), etc. etc. I cannot fault this hotel....it is simply excellent! Our "find" in Rome this time was "Hotel Eden" which is quite close to the Ottocento....it is ridiculously expensive but a visit to the top-floor bar at night is a must....great view over the city, cool jazz trio playing in the corner....and Jameson whiskey for 17 euro a pop!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: pinnacle2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome and stayed at the Ottocento for three nights. This was our first trip to Rome and were a bit intimidated by the city. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and patient with our numerous questions, not once did they hesitate to give us directions, suggestions for restaurants, etc. The location was absolutely perfect. I did extensive research on the internet regarding places to stay and i was very pleased I chose Ottocento. We were on a spotless, quiet side street maybe 200 ft from Via Veneto. We also walked the entire city from our location. The Spanish Steps are close, the Trevi Fountain as well. We found ourselves at a little cafe on Via Veneto each night after dinner called Suggestum. Great spot. By far, the best restaurant we ate at was Il Veneto. This was right on Via Veneto as well, same side of the street as Suggestum. We ate there for lunch twice and dinner once and the food was far superior to any other. Its a must!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: stroppymare
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the earlier reviews, and went with some trepidation after reading a few of the latter ones! However, I was not disappointed. The hotel is just off the Via Sistina a bustling area 1 min from Piazza Barberini and Via Veneto,, 5 mins to Trevi and Spanish Steps, about 20 mins to Colosseum. You can walk to any of the tourist sites with ease, as long as you wear comfortable shoes - many of the surrounding streetsare cobbled. Rooms: Small but very well appointed, clean, bed lined changed twice in 3 days. Our room overlooked the entrance to the hotel and when the windows and shutters were shut we were not disturbed atall. The room is air conditioned. I understand from a previous review that one room does not have a window - so prior to our arrival I contacted the hotel and asked for a room that did have just to be on the safe side! Bathroom : Has a fabulous spa bath, great after a long day on your feet, marble sink, and a fairly powerful hairdryer. Reception: staff speak excellent English, always friendly and helpful. Breakfast: Cereals, breads, pastries, jams, eggs, ham, cheese, fruit juices, teas, coffees. Roof Terrace Restaurant: The food was good but very expensive (98 euros for two without a sweet or coffee). Beer is approx 8 euros a glass. If you want any more inf plse feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but street noise ruined it”
Reviews.Author: PinkLadyTampa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful little hotel one night in Rome following a cruise. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was more than adequate. Our room was nice, though small; the bathroom is wonderfully appointed. Unfortunately, our room faced the street and the noise was apparent as soon as we checked in. We asked to be moved to another room but were assured that there would be no noise after dark, etc. Wrong! We were kept awake during the night due to constant horn blowing, cars zooming by and people talking loudly. At about $300 a night it was very disappointing. We would stay here again but insist on inspecting our room location prior to checking in.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, prices too high!”
Reviews.Author: varensell
Reviews.Content: stayed there april 2007 for four days with my 13yr old son. room was clean, very small, first floor, windows overlooking street, mildly loud, but not really disturbing. bed OK. bathroom very definitely above average, jacuzzi-tub working fine, shower too. in fact, the bathroom was the only feature of this hotel winning four stars. friendliness of reception and waiters gets 5 stars, all the rest is 3 star level. prices way up high, that is the main reason for my decision NOT to return to this place. concerning location, you couldn't do better. we walked all over rome from there, never needing a bus and using a cab only once. i am aware that there must be much worse places in rome hijacking money off tourists, but cannot understand that ottocento shall be number 55 in a list of 1.200??? if considering a trip to rome, you are well advised either to check further for a hotel with better value or to spend an extra 150 euros for a 5star place.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kamazz
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Ottocento is a small hotel located near Barberini Square. Personnel at the front desk are friendly and helpful from marking destinations on a map to arranging dinner reservations. The room was quite large based on European standards. A jetted tub was furnished in the attractive tiled bathroom. The provided breakfast was served in the restaurant attached to the hotel and included pastries, meats, cheeses, fresh bread, fruit, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, juices, coffee and tea. We stayed at several European hotels during our two weeks in Europe and the Ottocento was by far our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “The Utimate Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ladynred9
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for our Honeymoon and I never dreamed that the hotel would be nice enough to upgrade us to their suite. It was a beautiful two story room with european charm. It also had a quaint patio off of the living room to enjoy a nice breeze. The hotel staff was top notch. They also were very fluent in English. They provided us a map and gave us great advice. You can walk to any of the attractions and when your feet ache it is only minutes to the subway station. If you want some great gelato make sure to check out "Blue Ice" around the corner. The hotel's breakfast buffet was great. If you like pineapple juice theirs is the best. I couldn't say enough nice things about this hotel. We would definitely visit again

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricannyc77
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, the room nice and the location great.....

Reviews.Title: “no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: frostycp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June. While the location was great, the hotel nice, the air conditioning was turned off at night. When we inquired, we were told it was too expensive. I think when you book the room, you read air conditioning, you don't think not at night, when you are actually there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janglebangle
Reviews.Content: Overall had a really nice stay at this hotel but was extremely disappointed to discover that the jacuzzi in our bathroom did not work and obviously had not worked for some time. It was a public holiday followed by a weekend and as we were due to leave on the Tues morning it soon became obvious that we were not going to have the jacuzzi experience! This holiday was booked some 6 months in advance for a special occasion and I wanted things to be absolutely perfect. The hotel staff apologised but it was only on my insistence that I was expecting more than just an apology that I was offered a free meal in the restaurant by way of compensation. I also pointed out to the receptionist that the room rates had been reduced since I booked and that I would expect the lower room rate to be applied that she agreed to this. Had I not been cheeky enough to ask for this I am sure it would not have been offered. As I have said we could not fault anything else and the food in the restaurant was excellent, as was the friendliness of the staff. The hotel is ideally situated for all sites in Rome. We booked a De-luxe room but do not expect a large room - I think the only difference between de-luxe and standard is the size of the bed, which if anything makes the room seem smaller. If a large bed is important to you, go for de-luxe -and make sure you test the jacuzzi before you unpack!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Azucena32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for in Sep 2005 and we are going back in 2007 for our honeymoon because we loved it so much. It has an increadible location - walking distance to everything! We even walked to the Vatican. The hotel staff was increadibly helpful and the rooms where nicely decorated and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ordtravel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Ottocento. The hotel is centrally located to all the major sites in Rome. We had beautiful weather so we walked to all the sights -- Spanish Steps, Vatican, Coloseo, Pantheon and even walked back to it after having dinner in Travestere one night. If you have the time, I highly recommend dining in Travestere. It is where the locals live and dine and was entertaining. We dined at the Terrance our first night and it was really nice. Beware though, that there is a $5 cover charge so that was a surprise. The breakfast is adequate, nothing that knocked our socks off. We used the transfer service that the hotel can arrange which worked out well for us. The staff is very friendly, helpful and accomodating. All in all, a wonderful hotel to stay in. If we head back to Rome in the future, we will definately stay at the Ottocento.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in a convenient area”
Reviews.Author: Peter K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2006 and found it be very comfortable. The staff were very helpful & polite.The online booking was very good and we also took advantage of the hotel's offer to organise a car for us @ 50euros. The location is very convenient for the trevi fountain & the spanish steps. We ate in the restaurant the first night and thought it was average. We did not find the area expensive unless you strolled onto the Via Veneto at the top of the Piazza Barberini. However we dined in a few restaurants off the Piazza at the bottom of the Spanish Steps with an average cost 55 euros for two with two courses and wine which we would expect to pay at home in Yorkshire. Not a great deal of comparison !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coyotetraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the Ottocento! The location is beyond ideal, its perfect. We found all of the major sites and areas an easy walk from this hotel. The staff were very attentive, efficient, and competent. We reserved our cab through the front desk and it arrived 1 minute early. We needed stamps at the last minute for some postcards and the front desk person took it upon himself to find stamps and mail our postcards. The breakfast was very good with friendly and attentive service. The room was clean, modern, and very pleasant. Although the shower was more then crowded with several varieties of showers that seemed unnecessary to me. My only criticism is that we asked the front desk person what time we should leave for the airport given our flight time. She indicated a 7:45a.m. departure would get us there by 8:10a.m. Following her advise we arrived at the airport at 8:30a.m. I counted at least 6 international flight departures clustering around 10:30a.m. You can imagine the chaos. We stood in the security line for 75 minutes and we were the last ones to board our flight. Given that I still loved this hotel. I felt comfortable and well taken care of. On our next trip to Rome we would spend more time here both because of the location and desirability of this accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick!”
Reviews.Author: mpatterson
Reviews.Content: This was such a great pick! We did a ton of research before our trip and this one seemed like it would be a good choice - and it was! We went very end of July/early August. It's right around the corner from the nearest metro stop and very close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain area. We walked most places in Rome, even to and from the Colosseum twice. We did take the metro to the Vatican, even though you could walk. The hotel staff was very polite and accommodating. The only "compalint" was that when we arrived we had to wait close to an hour to be taken care of - the concierge was checking out a family and it took a while and then when it was our turn to check in , we just simply wanted our key after a long day of travel, but he kept talking and talking! It really wasn't that big of a deal and he was actually very nice, but we had already waited so long and just wanted to lay down and freshen up. Also, the staff is reluctant to give you dinner recommendations since they have their own restaurant. These were the only 2 downsides to staying there, and they honestly weren't enough for us to have a bad experience. In our opinion, we got a great deal!! We went through the hotel's website to book - we got the best deal through there, 160 euros/night, including a rooftop dinner for two, (pretty good food and great atmosphere and view) breakfast buffet (ok food - i personally didn't care for much of it, but they had a good selection and it was fresh), taxes/fees, and it was a 4 star hotel. The room was very nice - everything was very clean (i didn't feel disgusted once!) the bathroom was beautiful, the bed was very comfortable, and it was nice to come back to an air conditioned room after being in the heat all day! we took the train and then the metro to the hotel upon arrival into rome - it worked out just fine! we didn't want to do the same when we left in case we might miss our plane, so we took an airport shuttle (not the one the hotel provides) and it worked out perfectly. the one at the hotel is i think, 50 euros, which in my opinion is a lot! plus, it would have been more for us (i think an extra 10-20 euros) because we wanted to leave before 7am. we saw signs walking around the area for airport shuttles and they are much cheaper - if i remember correctly almost half the price. favorite restaurant: fortunato right by the pantheon. absolutely delicious food!!! the best we had in all of rome! the view and atmosphere outside is great and the prices are actually fairly reasonable. we will definitely eat there again if we go back to rome. overall, we loved the ottocento (be aware that there are several albergo's in rome, but the ottocento is probably the best). we would go back for sure and we think that the location and value were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bredo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this hotel. The location was outstanding. It was close to both the Barberini and Spagna Metro stops and an easy walk to the Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps. We were unexpectedly upgraded to a junior suite which was immaculate. It was a large room that was remarkably clean. The breakfast was better than most hotels (even had scrambled eggs) and the staff was outstanding. They were extremely helpful with restaurant reservations and airport connections (50 Euro cab ride). We would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable reliability”
Reviews.Author: GaryTodd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Hotel on our honeymoon. Unfortunately, we were told that there was no room available for us for our first night because the guests that were suppose to vacate our room decided to extend their stay. Rather than telling those guests to go to another hotel, they booked us in another hotel. We then had to leave and walk our luggage to the next hotel in the rain. No apology, no discount off the rest of our stay, nothing! They didn't even respond to our written complaint or e-mail. We reserved our room nine months in advance, but apparently this means nothing to management. Oh yeah, don't stay on the third floor because when they set-up the roof top patio (4th floor) you can hear them drag the furniture all over the place at 5:30 p.m., during the set-up and then at 10:30-11:00 p.m., when they're closing up. The room was clean, but small. The breakfast was was nothing special, we had better at other places on our trip. We found the location to be okay, but a bit far away from the major places/attractions that you want to see when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SDY71
Reviews.Content: After flight delays, security hassles, wrong trains, and getting lost on the way to the hotel (due to the fact that our guide book only had major routes in & not small side streets!), we finally arrived at the haven that is the Ottocento, to a fanstically warm welcome from the very mad, but lovely & helpful, Nicholas. Room was small, but still had plenty of room for 2 girls bags & shoes! Bathroom was fantastic, especially the spa-bath...much needed after a hard days sightseeing. I would recommend the Ottocento to all travellers, and would definitely stay there again on any more visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Super Ottocento!”
Reviews.Author: prospero1b
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Ottocento and can’t praise it too highly. This is a super little boutique 4* hotel in one of the best positions in Rome, about 5 minutes walk from both the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The entrance hall sets the tone for the hotel – sparkling marble and highly polished wood, with everywhere the scent of fresh flowers. Our room was a little on the small side, but very well equipped and quiet, overlooking an inside courtyard. There was an excellent bathroom, complete with Jacuzzi. Breakfast was ok – nothing special, but you don’t expect much on the Continent. We tried the rooftop restaurant, Tancredi, but it was rather lacking in atmosphere, although the cooking was very good. Plenty of excellent restaurants close by. Our stay coincided with the hottest weather Rome had had for some time – and that’s hot! We remained beautifully cool, thanks to very efficient air conditioning. This hotel is a real bargain – only £100 per night for a deluxe room. The staff is very pleasant and welcoming and did a lot to make it a memorable visit. It’s not the Hassler, but doesn’t charge Hassler prices. Of its type, it is outstanding, which is why I have given it a top rating. I recommend the Ottocento in the highest possible terms and will certainly use it again next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great choice!”
Reviews.Author: spiritj
Reviews.Content: As others have reviewed, this hotel is a cozy place in a great location. It's an easy walk to the Spanish steps, or the Trevi Fountain. Lots of restaurants around the corner, and a great gelato place called "Blue Ice" nearby. Nicolas at the front desk makes you feel at home, and is very helpful. Check-in and check-out is a breeze. Maps and directions are provided. Room is spotless; a little on the small side but very fine. One additional comment to the reviewer who posted that they should provide internet access: we were there in July and had free access to the internet anytime we wanted, by just walking in to the room at the back, behind the bar area. No problem at all, and very convenient. Perhaps all they needed to do was ask?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: Many others describe the excellent location of this hotel, so I'll let you read the details there. I'm adding my views given we visited in latter June, when it was quite warm (well into the 90's,) and this hotel was a great respite considering Rome prices. (We knew Rome is hot at this time, but we had a good opportunity to visit...) I should also mention that you are within an easy walk of the Via Veneto and its ritzy hotels, if you want an experience in that kind of cocktail lounge, etc. First, the room is not large, but as I expect for an older, renovated hotel in the central part of a European city (same as Paris, Geneva...) We had a fresh, contemporary room that overlooked the back on a high floor (4th or 5th, I forget,) and was quiet. The bathroom was pretty roomy, with good counterspace and a wonderful jacuzi. Spotless housekeeping. The air-conditioning worked nicely, and better than many places in Italy, where it is often under-power compared to American expectations. Don't expect ice-box cool, but few places in Italy have it at that level. The ground-floor restaurant has good food, good variety, and well-priced for the area. 'Very appreciated on these hot days and evenings: the air-conditioning in the dining room works well. Some neighborhood places claim to have AC, but it just brings the temperature from intolerable down to mildly uncomfortable. The dining room here is very comfortable, and we dined here a few times. (Too hot even for outdoor cafes.) The rooftop lounge and restaurant has a limited menu from the main dining room with some upcharge, and is a nice place for a drink when the weather cooperates. There is a small cocktail lounge, too. The desk staff are VERY helpful, espcially Nicholas, who seems to know everything that is happening around town. While we are great walkers, we often took the metro to avoid the heat or save our time for other things. There is a main metro stop a short walk away in the Piazza Barbarini. I have some minor complaints, but I emphasize -- minor -- for our purposes. The breakfast really could be better, based on our experience of 5 weeks in Europe this year, 2 weeks of which were in Italy. There is a very nice selection of breakfast breads and pastries; cereals; and some meats and cheeses. However, the juice and coffee were weak compared to ALL the other hotels; the fruit could be better; the milk one morning (for cereal) was almost warm; and the steam-table eggs were totally unattractive every day of our stay -- we couldn't bring ourselves to try them. They should forget the eggs and focus on the excellent breads pastries, and upgrading the rest. Also: this was one of the few hotels that did not have easy access to the internet. You COULD go around to the check-in desk, but this felt awkward and inconvenient. Even the other small hotels we visited has a computer for guest use (free or complimentary, whatever) in a more convenient location, if not hook-ups in the guest rooms and/or lounges. We don't need the internet a lot when on vacation, but my husband needed to check in to the office, and he preferred to go to a neighborhood internet cafe. This hotel has so many things right with it, it was surprising that they are not "with" this amenity. It would be a good addition to the cocktail lounge (quiet every time we peeked in.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda46
Reviews.Content: The Ottocento Hotel is a very nice hotel in the middle of Rome. The rooms are a little small but very nice decor. The beds are very comfortable with beautiful linens. The bathrooms are very nice and roomy. They have a resturant attached to the hotel that serves a breakfast buffet to the guests of the hotel each morning. The buffet was very surprising because of the vast variety of food items served. It was very nice and tasty. The very best thing about The Ottocento is their location. It is Wonderful!!! You are within walking distant to all of Rome's attractions. Use The Ottocento Hotel as your home away from home when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Ottocento”
Reviews.Author: Wicks
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is excellently located equidistant (about 5minutes walk) between both the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps in a quiet street called Via del Cappucini. The hotel is also a couple of minutes from Barberini Metro station which will take you to either the Colosseum or the Vatican (although we walked to both - about 30 minutes walk to each). The staff here are very friendly and eager to help with anything from restaurant recommendations to directions. Our room was 201 - and was on the second floor overlooking the street. Whilst other reviewers on here noted the traffic noise from street-facing rooms we had no such problems.
