I would say that the room (a standard double) was on the small side even by European standards and not the best value. The bathroom was good with a very nice invigorating shower. Buffet breakfast - on the ground floor was ok with plenty of choice. The bar/restaurant on the terrace was very pleasant but extortionately priced - 8 euros for a beer? We made use of the taxi transfers the hotel offered which was convenient. However the drivers in both directions drove like MANIACS. I've experienced some hairy rides in my time but 120 miles per hour nose to tail with the car in front is not the most relaxing way to begin a holiday. I would say to summarise that this hotel is a 3 star property trying very hard to achieve 4 star status. Its a little character-less but the staff here try very hard to make your stay an enjoyable one, which should be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tunkiemo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ottocento in April for three nights. We liked the location, found the reception-desk folks to be very helpful, were pleased with the hotel's offer of a 50Euro car-pickup from the airport and appreciated the open-access computer available for guests. Our room, a junior suite, was considerably smaller than the web site's photographs imply; we had a small patio enclosed within the building walls; the rooftop garden, which might be lovely in warmer weather, was closed. Breakfast was full and varied. For access and proximity to Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and even Piazza Navona, the hotel is a great starting or stopping point for walking, with adjacent access to the underground metro. For style and comfort, the hotel was small and boutiquey. Room-wise, I would likely search for another hotel before returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending five nights in the Ottocento.The experience from the point of being picked up by the hotels driver to the point of checking out was first class.Our de luxe room was larger than we expected and led out onto a private terrace.perfect for that glass of wine or two after a busy day walking around Rome. The room was very well appointed and spotlessly clean. The jacuzzi bath was much used during our stay. The restaurant within the hotel was great with a wide menu available at what was a competitive price for similar restaurants in Rome. The staff throughout the hotel were helpful and friendly and happily made museum and taxi bookings for us The location of the Ottocento was ideal for exploring the many sites of Rome .Its quiet location ensured a good nights sleep.We would happily recommend the hotel to our friends and hope to return ourselves in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkmck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Ottocento four nights, and after being away, we returned for one night before going home. The hotel, restaurant, staff and location were all excellent. We particularly enjoyed Sammy in the restaurant and Nicola at the front desk, but all the staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The hotel is located on a "quiet" street, but I would suggest asking for a room off the street. The noise of voices and Vespas was quite loud until early in the morning. The restaurant was very good - service and food. The location is ideal being 1 block from the Via Veneto and the Metro station. We found the metro to be convenient and easily accesible to go to the Colosseum and St. Peter's/Vatican. I have already recommended this hotel to two friends who are going to Rome, and I will definitely stay here the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: dillpop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in April and we had a wonderful time. We booked through expedia and when we got to the hotel they didn't have our booking as expedia had not faxed it through. The receptionist was very helpful in finding us a room and immeditaely upgraded us. The room was lovely, staff very helpful and the position fantastic. Thanks Ottocento.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation ruined by an iron”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came to the Albergo expecting a hidden gem, as suggested by the other reviews. I was extremely disappointed by the level and quality of service. I came to Rome on a work assignment for the European Commission. In order to go to work I needed 1 shirt ironed. To my surprise, the hotel has no irons or no laundry service on weekends. These two facts were no revealed to me until it was too late for me to purchase a shirt or an iron from a store. This was a complete fiasco and it gave me a miserable impression of this hotel, an impression that was not that high when I saw my room (with no windows). The qualiity of service that I received was deplorable and I would never set foot again here.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 day trip to rome where we stayed at the ottocento hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location just 5 minutes from Spanish steps and Via del Corso. The hotel itself is nicely decorated and very clean. I wouldn't really class it as a 4 star hotel as the facilities are very limited, it is perfect for sleeping and that's it. We upgraded to a deluxe room but don't bother, our friends stayed in a standard room and it was actually nicer than ours. DO NOT DRINK IN THE BAR!!! It was the most expensive gin & tonic I have had in my life. There was also building work going on which woke us every morning. I also believe it is fundamental to ask guests when chceking out "if everything was ok" especially after staying for 4 nights occupying 3 rooms in the hotel. There is an excellent restaurant across the road called "il corte dei leoni" if you are looking for authentic Italian food off the tourist track.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: yorks_nameless
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Ottocento in February 2006. The hotel was stylish in its decor, very clean and the breakfasts were substantial and delicious. We knew from earlier TripAdvisor reviews that the rooms were going to be on the small side (as is the case in many European cities) but found ours to be perfectly adequate. The room was clean and tastefully decorated. We found the bathroom to be cold and mentioned this to the receptionist but his suggested solution was a bit on the pathetic side. The room itself was warm but the heating didn't seem to reach the bathroom! The hotel is in a fantastic location, close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc. A tube station was easily reachable in less than 5 minutes. We were tucked away in a quiet area of the city but one that was close to the main sites, what more could one want from a city break? We should note that the price we were quoted when we booked in October 2005 was higher than in February 2006! We wouldn't have known this had we not looked at the hotel website just before our weekend break. On the plus side, the hotel honoured the reduced rate. Just wanted other guests to be aware of this, it might be an idea to check the price nearer your departure date in case of change! Overall, we would whole heartedly recommend the Ottocento. If you want a great quality hotel in a fantastic location at a great price then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived from Ireland on Sat25 and departed on Tue 28 Feb 2006. Hotel arranged car to collect us at airport. From the moment we arrived, everything was perfect. Very Nice and spotless room, great shower/bathroom, balcony etc. Staff were excellent and really customer focused. Room cost was 125 Euro which included breakfast (breakfast was great and there was a very good selection). Have travelled extensively around the world, stayed in some of the best hotels but this little 4 star is a super establishment and the staff are great. Located 3 mins walk from Spanish steps, and surrounded by shops and restaurants. All other sights within short walking distance. People working on days/evenings and nights at reception could not have been more helpful. When we return to Rome, we'll stay again at Ottocento.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ottocento lived up to the previous reviews posted on this site. The room was clean and comfortable, on the small side but average for European standards. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was much above average with whirlpool tub plus shower. Overall a very luxurious bathroom. Breakfast selections were very good, with scrambled eggs available each day plus a nice selection of cereals, fruit and breads. Location was also very good, within walking distance from many sites but the Metro and a taxi stand are a short block away for easy access to anywhere in the city. But the best part of the stay was the staff. Everyone from the chambermaids, the breakfast and restaurant staff as well as the front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. Nicola and Patrizia (sp? )were especially helpful, always willing to make suggestions, give directions, make reservations and point out things we should not miss. We would love to return to Rome and stay at the Ottocento sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived midday and was greeted by a friendly receptionist. Room was clean and well maintained although we had no windows just a very elaborate curtain with a brick wall behind it! Definitely not a good room for the summer months. Bathroom was nice and roomy but unfortunately on the Saturday night I was in the middle of washing my hair and the water turned cold. We had no hot water for over two hours so we were late for our dinner reservation. The receptionist was uanble to help and said that she was very embarassed about the situation. We were informed that as the hotel was fully occupied there was no other bathroom we could use. She kept repeating that she didn't know what the problem was but would get someone to have a look at the boiler. There was no management on site and when checking out the next day I asked to see the manager. I was informed that the manager had been told about the water situation but wasn't interested and that the manager had told the receptionist "not to get involved". I think this is a highly unprofessional attitude to have and felt that if we had been given an explanation as to why there was a lack of hot water we would have been a bit more forgiving but as far as a paying guest is concerned it seems like it was just tough luck and that we should live with it! Rome was wonderful and will definitely be returning but unfortunately we will be staying in a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Thrilled with the Ottocento”
Reviews.Author: kathiDublin_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Ottocento. It is small and on a quiet side street; our room was charming and the price was terrific! One afternoon we ran across the bartender on the street outside as we were leaving and he was arriving for work and he greeted us and said he hoped we would come by and see him again that night. The front desk clerk found us coffee, tea and pastries at 5a.m. while we waited for our car to the airport, and also sent us to a lovely little neighborhood trattoria that wasn't at all touristy. The location is terrific for walking to almost everything and we consider this our "find" in Rome. We did have to go up and down two or three steps in our hall to get to our room but that wasn't an obstacle for us. The Siegel's Dublin Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: cyberedie
Reviews.Content: Stayed w a friend 7 days including New year's! Just great! Smallish room but fine for us. Breakfast got a bit boring but it really was excellent overall. service from Patrizia and staff was always friendly and helpful. Hope it stays great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Really good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa_a
Reviews.Content: If I come back to Rome, I will stay here again without a doubt!! Hotel: The hotel is small and charming. It is very clean and comfortable. The breakfast room is fine and the coffee is excellent. The bar is very quiet but we enjoyed having a drink here in the evening before we went out. The bedrooms are on the small side but very clean and the spa bath is a good way to relax afer a long day shopping. Location: This is excellent! you are less than five minutes away from the spanish steps and also very near the via veneto. At the top of the road you can catch the open top bus for sightseeing, this leaves at 10am and you just pay as you get on the bus. We very much enjoyed the food at "La Fontenella" which was around the corner, very good value for money and simple, italian food!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff, great location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: khc425
Reviews.Content: The most impressive thing about our stay here was the friendly and helpful staff. During our three night stay, they helped us book a number of restaurant reservations, stayed on a voicemail system for quite some time in order to book a tour at Nero's golden house, and helped us arrange transportation to the airport. Somehow, they were always enthusiastic and made us feel welcome to ask for help. The second most impressive part of our stay was the comfortable bed. The bedding was not five star fancy, but of high quality, and the mattress had just the perfect bit of firmness. My wife and I have stayed at all types of hotels (many five star), and this was one of the most comfortable beds we've slept in. The location was also very convenient. We were a short walk to the Spanish Steps, a couple of blocks away from the Piazza Barberini for catching a taxi or the subway, and close to a number of restaurants in the area. The room was clean, and adequately sized but on the small side. The only minor gripe would be the noise level. Rome is a noisy city, and the hotel is in the middle of that noise. It's not a problem in the middle of the night, but it can disturb one's sleep around 6-7 am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel should be everyone's best kept secret. we are seasoned travellers and fell in love with the hotel immediately. while the rooms may be somewhat tight in terms of space when compared with north american hotels ( the norm in europe) they more than make up in their appointment. the bathroom facilities are excellent.rooms are kept spotless. it's location on a quiet side street makes sleeping in rome a dream, and it is just down the steet from the spanish steps and within easy reach of most attractions ie the trevi fountian piazza navonna etc. the staff is outstanding, knowledgable,proffessional and couteous beyond belief. you feel that you are home away from home. a boutique hotel in every sense of the word. there is more than ample choice re breakfast, cereals breads croissants eggs pastries etc. note; take up their offer to have a private driver pick you up at the airport. well worth it. joel & donna montreal quebec canada

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return: Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our two week vacation. The desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The airline lost our luggage and the hotel staff called the airline multiple times for us to try to get our luggage asap. The bathroom was nice, roomy and clean. Room had an enclosed patio attached. The room was clean and about average size for Europe. Breakfast was yummy: eggs, ham, cheese, fruit, bread, coffee, pastries, cereal, etc. quite good. We even sat in the little bar area one night before heading up to bed. They didn't have any dessert wines or port, but the bartender was very friendly and we tried some new things we never tried before. This hotel is in a great location - close to spanish steps and via veneto area & metro stop - safe area. I would definintely stay at this hotel again. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Ottocento was terrific”
Reviews.Author: Megabucks
Reviews.Content: As part of a two-week stay in Italy beginning 9-20-05, four of us spent six nights at the Hotel Ottocento in Rome. This was a very enjoyable experience. We wanted our trip to have a good beginning and Ottocento really set the standard for us. (Hotels we stayed in in Florence and Venice didn't come close to measuring up) Although the hotel is small in size, the efforts shown by all the staff were great! The rooms are tiny compared to most American motel rooms but they are nicely furnished and spotless. Anyone who loves redecorating would have certainly appreciated the beautiful plaster walls and color selections. The queen sized bed was more comfortable than ours at home! The bathrooms were the best! Each came with a full tub, with jacuzzi jets for great relaxing after a strenuous day walking in Rome. The best part of our stay however, was the care received from the Ottocento staff. The front desk crew, Patricia, Magdalena and Nicola were outstanding in their efforts to make us feel welcome throughout our stay. They were never too busy to stop and chat, point out the best direction to a destination or in one case, point us to the nearest 24 hour "bar" for a needed food emergency at 1 a.m! Everyone at the front desk spoke English very well and the rest of the staff accommodated our minimal use of Italian with a smile. The Ottocento served a lovely breakfast buffet which we certainly enjoyed every morning. Overall, the Ottocento was our welcome place of respite after the hectic pace of Rome each day. It's well located and walking distance from the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and the Borghese Gallery. Piazza Barberini with a Metro stop is only a short walk away. We would certainly return here the next time we travel to Rome and would highly recommend the hotel for other travelers. We threatened to leave a great review here with TripAdvisor and are happy to do so!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet side street in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CTDarien
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ottocento for five nights with my sister and my niece, who was on her way to a semester abroad program in Spain. The hotel is on a charming little side street, close to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, and the Villa Borghese. Our room featured modern decor (none of that flocked wallpaper and chandeliers!) and while cozy with three, was still manueuverable. The bathroom was really roomy...large enough that three women could move around in it at once. Breakfast was good...especially the coffee...and featured the usual yogurt, fruit, cheese samplings along with some very good rolls and croissants. The desk people were lovely, and went out of their way to be helpful and accomodating. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tahoek
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Europe you are always a little worried about your hotel choices. Well, the Albergo Ottocento, is truly a wonderful hotel. The service is excellent, Nick the receptionist is one of the most wonderul people you will ever meet. He will meet your every demand. The rooms are lovely, on the small side, but the bathrooms are perfect. The hotel is a small boutique hotel near the Spanish Steps. Walking distance to everything. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for central location, excellent service and wonderful accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt&Lou
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights in June. The hotel was in a fantastic location, close to both the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, yet it was in a quiet side street so you could relax after all the sight seeing. The decor of the hotel was beautiful and elegant and the staff were very helpful and friendly. One day, we decided to visit the Galleria Borghese and the Receptionist offered to book tickets for us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but needs air”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located ... just near the Spanish Steps and a reasonable walk to shopping, Trevi Fountain and other sights. Also conveniently located to transportation. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The only downfall was the air conditioning. It was a particularly hot week and we stayed on a high floor. It was difficult to sleep because it was so warm in the room. We tried contacting the manager to see if we could move to a lower floor, but never were given the courtesy of a response. We understood from other guests that the rooms on the lower floors were quite comfortable. We would stay here again, but if during a hot month would absolutely request to stay on a low floor.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be a nicer place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: USAGal
Reviews.Content: There can't be a nicer hotel in which to stay in all of Rome. Ottocento is on a tiny side street so you don't get overwhelmed by the hustle/bustle of Rome yet are a few minutes' walk from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain as well as a subway stop which makes getting to more distant attractions very inexpensive and easy. We loved the roof garden but there are many good restaurants within an easy walk from the hotel also. Staff was incredibly pleasant. They immediately knew everyone by name, it seemed. Rooms were comfortable. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “a 3 star + extras hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimmyBuyst
Reviews.Content: we returned from italy just 2 days. in rome, we stayed in hotel Ottocento for 4 nights. we booked 2 deluxe rooms. both had hydrobathtubs. definitely a treat after a day of walking through rome. on the other hand, during our 4 night stay the sheets were not changed. this would have been an extra since it was very hot in rome (35 degree celsius) staff is very friendly except for a waitress in the breakfast room. seems she doesnt like getting up so early. overall, a 3 star hotel with the 4th star added by the hydrobaths.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Tallula-18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in june 2005. The best part of this hotel is the service. Its a really small hotel and the staff at the desk are most helpful and go out of their way to make you happy.The position is great. We walked our feet off! It is close to the Spanish Steps and barberini square. The room was adequate. Rome is a big city and you may need to take transport to some sites such as the Vatican and the Colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall: good value for money by Italian standards. The best thing about this hotel was the location: as close to perfect as you’ll find in Rome without paying a fortune, it’s between the Spanish Steps (from where you can get the metro to the Colosseum/Forum/Palatine Hill in one direction and the Vatican in the other) and Piazza Barberini, and between Via Sistina and Via Veneto, all really close to the best shops. I had a nicely decorated, really small - but for Italy quite large - single room (see photo) that was kept perfectly clean. The food at breakfast was ok, 4-star, though service was somewhat brusque as in most places in Italy, and on Sunday there was no yoghurt. The staff at reception were friendly and eager to please before and during my stay, but they could have done more than they did to make up for a mishap with the car I’d ordered through them to pick me up at the airport so I wouldn’t have to queue for a taxi, because the driver, who went to a different terminal than I’d told them my flight would be arriving at (how hard is it to check flight arrival details on a screen?!), left me waiting a lot longer than I’d have waited for a taxi, and his car was old and unclean (and that for EUR 50, which in hindsight I shouldn’t have paid). A bus tour of the city that I took with a company they recommended was not at all worthwhile; the commentary was very superficial – just ask your taxi driver the names of the monuments, buildings and ruins and you pass on the way in from the airport and come across in your ambles through the nearby streets and you’ll be as wise. Still, I’d stay here again. TIP: to avoid the heinous queues at the Colosseum, buy a ticket to the Palatine Hill, which will get you into both without any queuing.

Reviews.Title: “Cool haven in June”
Reviews.Author: andyzim
Reviews.Content: In common with many other excellent reviews, we found this hotel to be ideal for a short stay in Rome: in our case, four nights. The staff couldn't have been more courteous and helpful. The weather was glorious - if anything a little too hot for the necessary footwork required to see this great city - so the hotel's central location was perfect, allowing for a midday return to shower and rest if necessary. The room was not large but perfectly adequate and well serviced. My only disappointment was with the quality v value of food available - which seemed to us to be a more widespread failing in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but air-conditioning only so-so!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGrossie
Reviews.Content: I was there recently for 2 different 2-day visits, separated by a cruise between. The hotel is in the perfect location. The rooms are small, not overly posh, but very modern and quite nice. The bathrooms are very nice, although the showers in the 3-person rooms and the 2 person deluxe rooms are quite narrow (and I'm not a large person). The staff is excellent, with the exception of the manager (whom I'm not sure I really know, I'll explain below). My one BIG complaint is that on our second stay there the weather was 35 celsius, that's 95 farenheit, with 100% humidity. Rome is disgusting in the heat. The air-conditioning in my room (305) was not nearly as strong as it should have been, and much less strong than the air conditioning in the other 2 rooms that were being stayed-in by my relatives. To make matters much worse they turn the A/C off at night in the entire hotel. The first night I awoke at 3:45am in a full sweat without any blankets or covers on me. By 4:30 I couldn't take it anymore and went down to the front desk and the gentleman there had the engineer turn on the A/C again. The next day I politely enquired about both my A/C and the hotel's policy of turning it off at night. Someone looked into my A/C and said it was working fine, which it was, but only barely. I mentioned to the day person and the evening person at the desk that I wish they wouldn't turn off the A/C at night when it was this hot. I was told that the manager asks them to do it every night, but they try not to when it's very hot out. That next night they turned it off even earlier, about 1:30 am, but I suspect that someone else complained because it was back on again by 2am, before I got aggravated enough to make the trip downstairs. My point is really that this hotel, while not as expensive as the big names, is by no means cheap. For 300-odd euros per night I would think they could leave the A/C on all night. Perhaps they could have each guest pay 5E more for the privilege of night-time A/C(maybe an electricity surcharge?). I would gladly pay it for a good night's sleep. Most of what I ask of a hotel is a good night's sleep, and unfortunately I was denied that by the Ottocento out of pure shortsightedness. Sorry for the rant. It's two nights later I'm still smarting from this!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DGMCK
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Rome. Stayed at the Ottocento. Great hotel, great location , staff really friendly & helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon on the basis of reviews posted on Trip Advisor and weren't disappointed. Great people, especially the reception staff, lovely rooms with great bathrooms and roof top restaurant. Ideally located for sightseeing and restaurants: just five minutes walk from Spanish Steps and ten minutes from Trevi Fountain. Despite being central, it was quiet and cool inside. Finally, it is reasonably priced. We'd go back without question and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ckp
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good place to stay. You can't beat the location -- within walking distance to everywhere (Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Metro). Front desk staff was friendly enough and provided a great map. Breakfast was marginal - mainly pastries and yogurts (at least I think that's what it was) - but adequate. The room was definitely a small one, but with a comfortable double bed (unlike our bed in Venice, which consisted of 2 twin beds pushed together!). The jacuzzi tub was an added bonus, and great to use after a loooong day of walking! I guess the price was good, considering the time of year -- 240 euro/night. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Un hotel bello!”
Reviews.Author: alw
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a city break in Rome, where we stayed at the Ottocento. We chose the hotel as a result of reading the reviews already posted and we were certainly not disappointed at all!! The hotel was perfectly situated just a few minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and the Piazza di Spagna; it was also within easy walking distance from the Trevi Fountain, the Vatican City, the Sistine Chapel, the Coloseum and most other main sights. The staff were very helpful and friendly - they were happy to organise our return transport to the hotel (which was in mercedes) , and draw a route on our map to the Vatican City and the Coloseum. Breakfast was lovely, with a wide range of items to choose from. Our rooms were beautifully decorated and were reasonably sizes, the hydrobaths were also fun!! We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone who was looking to go to Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo Ottocento
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Cappucini 19, 00187 Rome, Italy
